dialogues.text: All right, look. I tried, Ma.

dialogues.text: So I could end up like everyone else around here? People with college degrees living from paycheck to paycheck?

dialogues.text: I know three people came to my class on career day. Some computer technician. A store owner. Even a doctor. And all of them looked like poor, broke-down niggas.

dialogues.text: Watch your mouth!  25.

dialogues.text: Fine. All of them looked like broke-down “individuals.” Maybe if we lived next door to Donald Trump or Bill Cosby, it would be different. But I can’t see myself sitting in no school to end up like them.

dialogues.text: I have enough sense to see bums don't have chains. Bums don’t have rings. He pulls out a wad of cash.

dialogues.text: Puffy and Biggie sit with each other. THIS IS THE SCENE F THE START OF THE MOVIE.

dialogues.speaker: PUFFY
dialogues.text: You feel all this love we’re getting?

dialogues.speaker: BIGGIE
dialogues.text: (nods, then --) I just wanna give it all back. Suddenly, “Hypnotize” PLAYS.

dialogues.speaker: PUFFY
dialogues.text: Looks like you just did. The crowd dances as if this was the first party of the re of their lives. They need this... they want it.

dialogues.text: We did a hell of a lot in a short amount of time.

dialogues.speaker: BIGGIE
dialogues.text: We ain’t done, kid. Puffy raises his glass of champagne.  119.

dialogues.speaker: PUFFY
dialogues.text: Let’s change the world. Biggie raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: BIGGIE
dialogues.text: Can't change the world if we don’t change ourselves. They clink glasses.

dialogues.text: ANOTHER SONG IS BEING PLAYED. And just as the party is in full swing, FIRE MARSHALS ENTER. The CHIEF heads to the D booth.

dialogues.text: The angry crowd disperses.

dialogues.speaker: BIGGIE
dialogues.text: How ‘bout when I get back, we sit down and figure out what the fuck we're doing?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: We could do that. You all right?

dialogues.speaker: BIGGIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. You?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BIGGIE
dialogues.text: Later then.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Later. Biggie hangs up. An attractive, young woman named, TISHA, approaches.  121.

dialogues.speaker: TISHA
dialogues.text: Biggie, can I have an autograph?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Sorry, he ain't doing autographs tonight. As Tisha backs away, Biggie notices the Bob Marley T-shir she is wearing.

dialogues.speaker: BIGGIE
dialogues.text: Hold up. We gotta make it quick, sweetheart. Tisha hands him a sheet of paper and he signs. Then the Valet arrives with Biggie’s Suburban rental. The Bad Boy caravan pulls off together. Puffy’s Suburban, the lead. Biggie’s Suburban, second. And the limo, bringi up the rear.

dialogues.text: Surgery.

dialogues.text: A SMALL CROWD OF FANS start to arrive. People hold hands outside, praying. Faith pulls up in a cab. She rushes to the front and a COP stops her.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: We're not letting any more in. A FAN jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: FAN
dialogues.text: That's his ex-wife. The Cop backs away. CAMERA stays with Faith. She walks down the hall, shaking Someone at the desk directs her. Faith goes down another hall. She finds everyone in the waiting room.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Is he okay?

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: We're still waiting.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Me... Me and Big, we had a stupid argument on the phone. I... I hung up on him. Mark hugs her as she bursts out in tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. It’s okay.  124. The DOCTOR approaches. Faith holds her breath. Everyone, with looks of desperate hope -- .

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I'm very sorry. He’s gone. Faith crumples. Cease holds his head in anguish. Puffy punches the wall. Damien falls back in a chair, sobbing. Mark nervously grabs his cell. His hand is shaking. His whole body is shaking. The tears won't stop.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: We got to... We got to tell Miss Wallace... He dials and then loses his composure. Helplessly, he loo at Damien.

dialogues.text: I... I can’t... Damien takes the phone. INT. VOLETTA’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Voletta is sleeping when the PHONE RINGS. The clock reads five-twenty-one a.m. Voletta picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: VOLETTA
dialogues.text: Hello? DAMIEN’S VOICE (sobbing) Miss Wallace!!! Miss Wallace!!! CAMERA moves in on Voletta as the phone drops out of her hands. THE SCREEN GOES BLACK.

dialogues.text: Biggie’s old block is crammed with so many PEOPLE that yo can’t see the sidewalk. People stand on top of cars. If nothing else, WE SEE A COMMUNITY.

dialogues.speaker: BIGGIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I used to say I was ready to die. But at the time of my death, maybe for the first time ever, I was ready to live. INT. VOLETTA’S LIMOUSINE - DAY Voletta looks out of the window, witnessing this outpouri of love. It is reminiscent of Bob Marley’s funeral.

dialogues.text: I went from being Chrissy-Pooh to Biggie Smalls to Daddy to... toa man. That’s something no one can take away from me. That was my greatest achievement...
